meanings.sent1: The hypercompetitive market made it difficult for new businesses to succeed.
meanings.sent2: The company thrived in the hypercompetitive industry by constantly innovating.
meanings.sent3: The hypercompetitive siblings raced each other to the dinner table every night.
meanings.sent4: Her hypercompetitive spirit was like a fierce lion fighting for its territory.
meanings.sent5: In the world of hypercompetitive sports, only the strongest athletes could win.

meanings.definition: Characterized by intense competition or rivalry.
meanings.sent1: The hypercompetitive nature of the game kept the players on edge.
meanings.sent2: The team's hypercompetitive attitude drove them to always strive for excellence.
meanings.sent3: The hypercompetitive neighbors competed to have the best-decorated houses during the holidays.
meanings.sent4: The market was a battlefield, with companies engaging in hypercompetitive strategies to gain an edge.
meanings.sent5: The hypercompetitive atmosphere in the office pushed employees to perform at their best.
